perturbation.original_text: Section 5.4 Payment. Recipient shall pay, or cause to be paid, the Fees shown on an invoice no later than the last business day of the month Recipient received such invoice unless disputed in accordance with Section 5.7. Any amount not received from the invoiced Party within such period shall bear interest at the Applicable Rate, from and including the last date of such period to, but excluding, the date of payment.
perturbation.changed_text: Section 5.4 Payment. Recipient shall pay, or cause to be paid, the Fees shown on an invoice no later than fifteen (15) days after the date of the invoice unless disputed in accordance with Section 5.7. Any amount not received from the invoiced Party within sixty (60) days of the invoice date shall bear interest at the Applicable Rate, from and including the last date of such period to, but excluding, the date of payment.
perturbation.explanation: This change creates an in-text contradiction regarding payment deadlines. The first sentence states payment is due by the last business day of the month the invoice is received, while the second sentence implies payments are due 15 days after the invoice date. The discrepancy creates uncertainty regarding when late fees are applied, as one deadline is based on invoice receipt and the other on the invoice date. Furthermore, it adds a 60 day grace period before interest is applied, contrary to the immediately preceding sentence.

perturbation.original_text: Section 10.11 Multi-party Contracts. The Company and RGHI will use all commercially reasonable efforts to obtain within 24 months following the Commencement Date, from the counterparty to each Multi-party Contract any needed consent to separate the portion of such contract that relates to the goods or services purchased from or supplied to the Business under such Multi-party Contract (including but not limited to assignment or partial assignment of such contracts to the Company or RGHI or its Affiliates).
perturbation.changed_text: Section 10.11 Multi-party Contracts. The Company and RGHI will use all commercially reasonable efforts to obtain within 6 months following the Commencement Date, from the counterparty to each Multi-party Contract any needed consent to separate the portion of such contract that relates to the goods or services purchased from or supplied to the Business under such Multi-party Contract (including but not limited to assignment or partial assignment of such contracts to the Company or RGHI or its Affiliates).
